title: Gunman in Texas linked himself to terrorist in tweet
description: Elton Simpson, named as one of two attackers, publicly pledged support to an ISIS fighter. FULL STORY

title: Bergen: Cartoon shooting in U.S. was inevitable
description: It was only a matter of time before this would happen in the United States.

title: Why images of Mohammed offend many
description: Violence over depictions of the Prophet Mohammed may mystify many non-Muslims, but it speaks to a central tenet of Islam: the worship of God alone.

title: Royal baby's name revealed
description: And the princess has a name!

title: Carly Fiorina: 'Yes, I am running'
description: Former Hewlett-Packard CEO Carly Fiorina announced her candidacy for president on Monday, becoming the first declared female candidate to seek the Republican Party's nomination.

title: Ben Carson joins 2016 race
description: Ben Carson wants to convince voters that a doctor is best positioned to fix what's ailing America.

title: Drawdown begins in Baltimore
description: Things could be returning to normal in Baltimore: The city has lifted its curfew, the National Guard is preparing its exit and a mall that had been a flashpoint in the riots has been reopened.

title: Black men missing in Baltimore
description: Something is missing from the neighborhood CNN's John Blake grew up in: older black men. FULL STORY

title: Obama relaunching initiative
description: President Barack Obama will re-launch his "My Brother's Keeper" initiative into a new, nonprofit foundation -- a clue into what work the President will take on in his post-presidency years.

title: Israel's 'raw wound' revealed
description: The clashes between Ethiopian-Israeli protesters and police over the weekend have drawn international attention to one of the most disadvantaged groups in Israel.

title: Journey to epicenter of quake
description: More than 1,400 meters above sea level, amidst Nepal's treacherous alpine terrain, an entire mountain is shaking.

title: 10-year-old denied abortion
description: An international rights group is pressing Paraguay to allow an abortion for a 10-year-old girl, who allegedly was raped by her stepfather. CNN's Rafael Romo reports.

title: Hangar of Japan's aircraft carrier sub found
description: Piece by piece, the depths of the Pacific are giving up the story of World War II.

title: 'Star Trek' yeoman dead at 85
description: Grace Lee Whitney, who played Yeoman Janice Rand in the original "Star Trek" series and a handful of movies based on the series, died Friday. She was 85.

title: 'Star Wars' director pulls out
description: A new batch of planned "Star Wars" movies suffered a setback after director Josh Trank pulled out of the project.

title: A weird new use for your fingernail
description: NailO, a wearable tech device, turns your thumbnail into wireless mouse. CNN's Thom Patterson reports.

title: Rugby star collapses on field, dies
description: The world of rugby league is in mourning following the death of Wales international Danny Jones, who passed away after collapsing during a game on Sunday.

title: Sea monster fossil discovered
description: A farmer in Australia discovered a fossil belonging to a 100 million-year-old sea predator known as a "Kronosaurus."

title: Sleep terrors as kid? You might sleepwalk
description: Does your little one suffer from sleep terrors? Then get ready to lock the window and doors, because they might soon sleepwalk, too. A study of nearly 2,000 children in Quebec over a 12-year period found that as many as a third of the children who had early childhood sleep terrors became sleepwalkers later.

title: The killings at Kent State: 45 years ago today
description: Four students died and nine others were wounded on May 4, 1970, when members of the Ohio National Guard opened fire on students protesting the Vietnam War at Kent State University in Ohio.

title: World's most incredible sailing images
description: The Mirabaud Yacht Racing Image Awards attracts stunning sailing photography -- here are the best photos selected over the past four competitions.

title: Lindsey Vonn and Tiger Woods split
description: Skier Linsday Vonn announced Sunday that she and Tiger Woods are parting ways, citing the strain of their busy schedules.

title: Big announcement from Decker and Roddick
Trick your brain to avoid 'portion distortion'
description: Your diet may be wrecked by your eyes and the size of your plates.

title: Why do we celebrate Cinco de Mayo?
description: Guacamole and fajitas. Mexican flags and mariachi bands. Margaritas, beer -- and more beer. (Sometimes with lime, thanks to that clever marketing campaign.)

title: Sea lion attacks man, drags him underwater
description: A sea lion attacked a fisherman in California and dragged him underwater. CNN affiliate KGTV reports.

title: 6th-grader cuts off long-winded Obama
description: During a "virtual field trip" Thursday, President Obama began to ramble. The Washington, D.C., sixth-grade moderator promptly cut him off.

title: 'Bubble girl' is allergic to life
description: Brynn Duncan might as well live in a bubble. She suffers from mast cell activation syndrome, a rare disease that makes her allergic to almost everything.

title: Put down that energy drink!
description: You don't need it with these tips on how to stay energized throughout the day from CNN Chief Medical Correspondent Dr. Sanjay Gupta.

title: Fancy hats from the Kentucky Derby
Surreal photos of classic fairy tales
description: You don't have to be well-versed in Russian folklore to appreciate this dream-like take on classic stories.

title: Fleeing where homosexuality is illegal
description: They left Iran unwillingly, often in a hurry. It was for the best for these refugees. Iran is a difficult place to be gay or lesbian.

title: The Dzhokhar Tsarnaev his lawyers want you to know
description: I never expected to feel sorry for Dzhokhar Tsarnaev.

title: Why was CNN invited back to North Korea?
description: Last September, I made my first visit to North Korea, granted a rare glimpse of what goes on beyond the demilitarized zone, in one of the most mysterious places on Earth.

title: Seeing God in the face of Freddie Gray
description: Freddie Gray, Walter Scott, Eric Garner, Michael Brown, Tamir Rice, John Crawford, Jonathan Ferrell, Jordan Davis, Trayvon Martin ... Emmett Till.

title: How to help Baltimore rebuild
description: In the aftermath of the rioting and destruction in Baltimore after Freddie Gray's death, the community needs your help to rebuild -- structurally and emotionally.

title: Dreams 'scattered' by Nepal quake
description: Two CNN Heroes are among the earthquake survivors in Kathmandu, Nepal. And they are struggling in the aftermath.

title: Pit bull is patient zero in Colorado's cases of plague
description: A pit bull was at the heart of a rare plague outbreak in Colorado that left four people sick last year. That's what a Centers for Disease Control and Prevention investigation found in a new report released April 30.

title: Former racehorses get a second chance at life
description: Wooden Phone was never asked whether he wanted to race. Born in 1997, the dull-brown thoroughbred didn't show initial signs of greatness, but the horse would net more than $800,000 in winnings during his career.

title: Newly discovered frog looks like Kermit
description: Hi-ho, Kermit the Frog has some competition.

title: With 1 male left worldwide, northern white rhinos under guard
description: At first glance, Sudan looks like any other northern white rhino: stout and agile, with square lips.

title: Gorilla cracks zoo window, sends family running
description: A family trip to a Nebraska zoo turned terrifying for one family after the gorilla they were looking at leaped toward the exhibit window, cracking it.

title: Soccer star's wife dies from cancer
description: English soccer star Rio Ferdinand paid tribute to his "wonderful wife" on Saturday after she passed away following a cancer diagnosis.

title: Boehner OK with $$$ in politics
description: Americans might see their political system as rigged against them and in favor of big-money donors, special interests and incumbent members of Congress.

title: Jeffrey Dahmer's killer: Why I did it
description: The man who beat serial killer Jeffrey Dahmer to death inside a Wisconsin prison says he did it because of Dahmer's creepy sense of humor -- which included turning prison food into fake limbs covered with ketchup to resemble blood, the New York Post reports.

title: First Air Force One wasting away in the desert
description: You would expect the very first Air Force One to be preserved in a museum somewhere. But it isn't. It's literally baking on a patch of land in the Arizona desert.

title: New on Netflix, Amazon Prime, Hulu
description: April showers surely will bring May flowers -- if by flowers you mean tons of streaming options.

title: 'Puffed up planet' discovered
description: A huge "puffed up" planet "too big for its star" some 500 light years from Earth has been discovered by Australian researchers -- with the help of a backyard astronomer.

title: 'Revenge' canceled. What's next?
description: View this list of canceled TV shows to see which ones have gotten the ax.

title: Baby born after mom dies
description: A newborn infant survived against the odds just weeks after his mother suffered a fatal intracranial hemorrhage. CNN affiliate KETV has the story.
